# hyperping_incident_update (Resource)

Manages an update to a Hyperping incident. Use this to add status updates to an incident timeline.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Create an incident with updates
resource "hyperping_incident" "api_outage" {
  title    = "API Service Degradation"
  type     = "incident"
  status   = "investigating"
  monitors = [hyperping_monitor.api.id]
}

# Initial update - investigating
resource "hyperping_incident_update" "investigating" {
  incident_id = hyperping_incident.api_outage.id
  type        = "investigating"
  text        = "We are investigating reports of slow API response times."
}

# Follow-up update - identified
resource "hyperping_incident_update" "identified" {
  incident_id = hyperping_incident.api_outage.id
  type        = "identified"
  text        = "The issue has been identified as a database connection pool exhaustion."

  depends_on = [hyperping_incident_update.investigating]
}

# Resolution update
resource "hyperping_incident_update" "resolved" {
  incident_id = hyperping_incident.api_outage.id
  type        = "resolved"
  text        = "Database connection pool has been increased. All services operating normally."

  depends_on = [hyperping_incident_update.identified]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `incident_id` (String) The UUID of the incident to add the update to.
- `text` (String) The text content of the update (English).
- `type` (String) The type of update. Valid values: `investigating`, `identified`, `update`, `monitoring`, `resolved`.

### Optional

- `date` (String) The date of the update in ISO 8601 format. If not provided, the current time is used.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the update (format: incident_id/update_id).

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import an incident update using the composite ID (incident_id/update_id)
terraform import hyperping_incident_update.example "inc_abc123/upd_xyz789"
```

**Note:** The ID format is `incident_id/update_id`. You can find the update ID in the Hyperping dashboard or API response.
